parameter.description: Sets the domain name to provide to clients on the LAN interface.

parameter.name: IPRouters
parameter.description: IP addresses of routers on this subnet. Also known as default gateway. Support for more than one Router address is OPTIONAL.

parameter.name: DHCPLeaseTime
parameter.description: Specifies the lease time in seconds of client assigned addresses. A value of -1 indicates an infinite lease.

parameter.name: UseAllocatedWAN
parameter.description: Controls use of addresses from the associated WAN connection. {{enum}} If {{enum|Normal}}, the address pool is directly configured by the ACS. If {{enum|UseAllocatedSubnet}}, behavior is the same as for {{enum|Passthrough}} with an empty {{param|PassthroughMACAddress}}. For this reason, {{enum|UseAllocatedSubnet}} is DEPRECATED. If {{enum|Passthrough}}, and {{param|PassthroughMACAddress}} is {{empty}}, the configured values of the {{param|MinAddress}}, {{param|MaxAddress}}, {{param|SubnetMask}} and {{param|DNSServers}} parameters are ignored. The corresponding address pool values are instead taken from the WAN connection specified by {{param|AssociatedConnection}}. If {{enum|Passthrough}}, and {{param|PassthroughMACAddress}} is not {{empty}}, the LAN Host identified by {{param|PassthroughMACAddress}} is given a WAN IP address from the WAN connection specified by {{param|AssociatedConnection}}. Other LAN Hosts are treated as for {{enum|Normal}}. Use of {{param|PassthroughMACAddress}} does not cover the case where more than one LAN Host is to be given a WAN IP address. This can be achieved by using a DHCP conditional serving pool.

parameter.name: AssociatedConnection
parameter.description: {{reference|the connection instance to be used for address allocation if {{param|UseAllocatedWAN}} is set to {{enum|UseAllocatedSubnet|UseAllocatedWAN}} or {{enum|Passthrough|UseAllocatedWAN}}}} The content is the full hierarchical parameter name of a WAN-side layer 3 connection object. Example: ''InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.1.WANConnectionDevice.2.WANPPPConnection.1''. If {{param|UseAllocatedWAN}} is {{enum|UseAllocatedSubnet|UseAllocatedWAN}} or {{enum|Passthrough|UseAllocatedWAN}}, this parameter MUST have a valid value before the DHCP server can be enabled.

parameter.name: PassthroughLease
parameter.description: DHCP lease time in seconds given to the LAN Host that is used to passthrough a WAN IP address if {{param|UseAllocatedWAN}} is {{enum|Passthrough|UseAllocatedWAN}}. Note: A temporary private IP address with short lease (for example, 1 min) might be given to the passthrough LAN Host before the WAN IP address is acquired.

parameter.name: PassthroughMACAddress
parameter.description: Hardware address of the LAN Host that is used to passthrough a WAN IP address if {{param|UseAllocatedWAN}} is {{enum|Passthrough|UseAllocatedWAN}}. Note: {{empty}} indicates that no specific LAN Host is designated, and results in the same behavior as the (DEPRECATED) {{enum|UseAllocatedSubnet|UseAllocatedWAN}}.

parameter.name: AllowedMACAddresses
parameter.description: Hardware addresses that are allowed to connect to this connection if ''MACAddressControlEnabled'' is 1 for a given interface.

parameter.name: IPInterfaceNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: The number of entries in the {{object|IPInterface}} table.

parameter.name: DHCPStaticAddressNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: The number of entries in the {{object|DHCPStaticAddress}} table.

parameter.name: DHCPOptionNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: The number of entries in the {{object|DHCPOption}} table.

parameter.name: DHCPConditionalPoolNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: The number of entries in the {{object|DHCPConditionalServingPool}} table.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.LANHostConfigManagement.IPInterface.{i}.
object.description: IP address table with each object representing an IP address on the LANDevice IP interface. Support for more than one interface instance is OPTIONAL.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this entry. On creation, an entry is disabled by default.

parameter.name: IPInterfaceIPAddress
parameter.description: IP address of the LAN-side interface of the CPE.

parameter.name: IPInterfaceSubnetMask
parameter.description: Subnet mask of the LAN-side interface of the IGD.

parameter.name: IPInterfaceAddressingType
parameter.description: Represents the addressing method used to assign the LAN-side IP address of the CPE on this interface.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.LANHostConfigManagement.DHCPOption.{i}.
object.description: This object specifies the DHCP options that MUST, if enabled, be returned to clients whose DHCP requests do not match any of the DHCP conditional serving pool entries.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this DHCPOption table entry.

parameter.name: Tag
parameter.description: Option tag as defined in RFC 2132 {{bibref|RFC2132}}.

parameter.name: Value
parameter.description: Base64 encoded option value.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.LANHostConfigManagement.DHCPConditionalServingPool.{i}.
object.description: DHCP conditional serving pool table. Each instance of this object defines a DHCP conditional serving pool. Client requests are associated with pools based on criteria such as source interface, supplied DHCP options, and MAC address. If a DHCP request does not match any of the DHCP conditional serving pool entries, the handling of the request is determined by the default DHCP server behavior that is defined by the LANHostConfigManagement object. Overlapping pool ranges MUST be supported.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the DHCPConditionalServingPool entry.

parameter.name: PoolOrder
parameter.description: Position of the pool entry in the order of precedence. A value of 1 indicates the first entry considered. For each DHCP request, the highest ordered entry that matches the association criteria is applied. All lower order entries are ignored. When this value is modified, if the value matches that of an existing entry, the Order value for the existing entry and all lower Order entries is incremented (lowered in precedence) to ensure uniqueness of this value. A deletion causes Order values to be compacted. When a value is changed, incrementing occurs before compaction. The value on creation of a DHCPConditionalServingPool table entry MUST be one greater than the largest current value.

parameter.name: SourceInterface
parameter.description: Pool association criterion. {{list}} {{reference|the layer 2 ingress interfaces associated with this entry, i.e. the corresponding ''LAN**InterfaceConfig'' or ''WLANConfiguration'' objects}} For example: ''InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.1.LANEthernetInterfaceConfig.2,InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.1.WLANConfiguration.3'' {{empty}} indicates this entry is to apply to all layer 2 interface objects under this ''LANDevice'' instance.

parameter.name: VendorClassID
parameter.description: Pool association criterion. Used to identify one or more LAN devices, value of the DHCP Vendor Class Identifier (Option 60) as defined in RFC 2132 {{bibref|RFC2132}}, matched according to the criterion in {{param|VendorClassIDMode}}. Case sensitive. {{empty}} indicates this criterion is not used for conditional serving.

parameter.name: VendorClassIDExclude
parameter.description: If {{false}}, matching packets are those that match the {{param|VendorClassID}} entry, if specified. If {{true}}, matching packets are those that do not match the {{param|VendorClassID}} entry, if specified.

parameter.name: VendorClassIDMode
parameter.description: {{param|VendorClassID}} pattern match criterion. {{enum}} For example, if {{param|VendorClassID}} is "Example" then an Option 60 value of "Example device" will match with {{param}} values of {{enum|Prefix}} or {{enum|Substring}}, but not with {{enum|Exact}} or {{enum|Suffix}}.

parameter.name: ClientID
parameter.description: Pool association criterion. Used to identify one or more LAN devices, value of the DHCP Client Identifier (Option 61) as defined in RFC 2132 {{bibref|RFC2132}}. The option value is binary, so an exact match is REQUIRED. {{empty}} indicates this criterion is not used for conditional serving.

parameter.name: ClientIDExclude
parameter.description: If {{false}}, matching packets are those that match the {{param|ClientID}} entry, if specified. If {{true}}, matching packets are those that do not match the {{param|ClientID}} entry, if specified.

parameter.name: UserClassID
parameter.description: Pool association criterion. Used to identify one or more LAN devices, value of the DHCP User Class Identifier (Option 77) as defined in RFC 3004 {{bibref|RFC3004}}. {{empty}} indicates this criterion is not used for conditional serving.

parameter.name: UserClassIDExclude
parameter.description: If {{false}}, matching packets are those that match the {{param|UserClassID}} entry, if specified. If {{true}}, matching packets are those that do not match the {{param|UserClassID}} entry, if specified.

parameter.name: Chaddr
parameter.description: Pool association criterion. Hardware address (MAC address.) of the physical interface of the DHCP client. {{empty}} indicates this criterion is not used for conditional serving.

parameter.name: ChaddrMask
parameter.description: Bit-mask for the MAC address, where matching of a packet's MAC address with the {{param|Chaddr}} is only to be done for bit positions set to one in the mask. A mask of FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF or {{empty}} indicates all bits of the {{param|Chaddr}} are to be used for conditional serving classification.

parameter.name: ChaddrExclude
parameter.description: If {{false}}, matching packets are those that match the (masked) {{param|Chaddr}} entry, if specified. If {{true}}, matching packets are those that do not match the (masked) {{param|Chaddr}} entry, if specified.

parameter.name: LocallyServed
parameter.description: If {{true}}, then the local DHCP server will assign an IP address from the specific address pool specified in this object. If {{false}}, the DHCP server will send the request to the {{param|DHCPServerIPAddress}} configured for this pool.

parameter.name: MinAddress
parameter.description: Specifies first address in the pool to be assigned by the DHCP server on the LAN interface. This parameter is configurable only if {{param|UseAllocatedWAN}} is {{enum|Normal|UseAllocatedWAN}}. This parameter MUST have a valid value before this pool can be enabled.

parameter.name: MaxAddress
parameter.description: Specifies last address in the pool to be assigned by the DHCP server on the LAN interface. This parameter is configurable only if {{param|UseAllocatedWAN}} is {{enum|Normal|UseAllocatedWAN}}. This parameter MUST have a valid value before this pool can be enabled.

parameter.name: ReservedAddresses
parameter.description: IP addresses marked reserved from the address allocation pool.

parameter.name: SubnetMask
parameter.description: Specifies the client's network subnet mask. This parameter is configurable only if {{param|UseAllocatedWAN}} is {{enum|Normal|UseAllocatedWAN}}. This parameter MUST have a valid value before this pool can be enabled.

parameter.name: DNSServers
parameter.description: DNS servers offered to DHCP clients. Support for more than three DNS Servers is OPTIONAL. This parameter is configurable only if {{param|UseAllocatedWAN}} is {{enum|Normal|UseAllocatedWAN}}.

parameter.name: DomainName
parameter.description: Sets the domain name to provide to clients on the LAN interface.

parameter.name: IPRouters
parameter.description: IP addresses of routers on this subnet. Also known as default gateway. Support for more than one Router address is OPTIONAL.

parameter.name: DHCPLeaseTime
parameter.description: Specifies the lease time in seconds of client assigned addresses. A value of -1 indicates an infinite lease.

parameter.name: UseAllocatedWAN
AssociatedConnection
parameter.description: {{reference|the connection instance to be used for address allocation if {{param|UseAllocatedWAN}} is set to {{enum|Passthrough|UseAllocatedWAN}}}} The content is the full hierarchical parameter name of a WAN-side layer 3 connection object. Example: ''InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.1.WANConnectionDevice.2.WANPPPConnection.1''. If {{param|UseAllocatedWAN}} is {{enum|Passthrough|UseAllocatedWAN}}, this parameter MUST have a valid value before this pool can be enabled.

parameter.name: DHCPServerIPAddress
parameter.description: IP address of the DHCP server, where the request has to be sent to when there is a conditional match with this pool and {{param|LocallyServed}} is {{false}}. If this parameter is not configured, then the DHCP request is dropped.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.LANEthernetInterfaceConfig.{i}.
object.description: This object models an Ethernet LAN connection on a CPE device. This object MUST be implemented for CPE that contain an Ethernet interface on the LAN side.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this interface.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the status of this interface. {{enum}} The {{enum|Error}} value MAY be used by the CPE to indicate a locally defined error condition.

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: The name of this layer 2 interface, chosen by the vendor, e.g. "eth0" or "eth0:1".

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description: The physical address of the interface.

parameter.name: MACAddressControlEnabled
parameter.description: Indicates whether MAC Address Control is enabled or not on this interface. MAC Address Control limits the clients that connect to those that match a list of allowed MAC addresses specified in {{param|InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.LANHostConfigManagement.AllowedMACAddresses}}.

parameter.name: MaxBitRate
parameter.description: The maximum upstream and downstream bit rate available to this connection.

parameter.name: DuplexMode
parameter.description: The duplex mode available to this connection.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.LANEthernetInterfaceConfig.{i}.Stats.
object.description: This object contains statistics for an Ethernet LAN interface on a CPE device. Note that these statistics refer to the link layer, not to the physical layer.

parameter.name: BytesSent
parameter.description: The total number of bytes transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: BytesReceived
parameter.description: The total number of bytes received on the interface, including framing characters. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: PacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets transmitted out of the interface. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: PacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of packets which were received on this interface. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: ErrorsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: ErrorsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: UnicastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets requested for transmission which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address, including those that were discarded or not sent. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: UnicastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being transmitted. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets requested for transmission which were addressed to a multicast address, including those that were discarded or not sent. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets which were addressed to a multicast address. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets requested for transmission which were addressed to a broadcast address, including those that were discarded or not sent. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets which were addressed to a broadcast address. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: UnknownProtoPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of packets received via the interface which were discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.LANUSBInterfaceConfig.{i}.
object.description: This object models a USB LAN connection on a CPE device. This object MUST be implemented for CPE that contain a USB interface on the LAN side.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this interface.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the status of this interface. {{enum}} The {{enum|Error}} value MAY be used by the CPE to indicate a locally defined error condition.

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: The name of this layer 2 interface, chosen by the vendor, e.g. "usb0".

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description: The physical address of the interface.

parameter.name: MACAddressControlEnabled
parameter.description: Indicates whether MAC Address Control is enabled or not on this interface. MAC Address Control limits the clients that connect to those that match a list of allowed MAC addresses specified in {{param|InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.LANHostConfigManagement.AllowedMACAddresses}}.

parameter.name: Standard
parameter.description: USB version supported by the device.

parameter.name: Type
parameter.description: Type of the USB interface.

parameter.name: Rate
parameter.description: Speed of the USB interface.

parameter.name: Power
parameter.description: Power configuration of the USB interface.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.LANUSBInterfaceConfig.{i}.Stats.
object.description: This object contains statistics for a USB LAN interface on a CPE device. Note that these statistics refer to the link layer, not to the physical layer.

parameter.name: BytesSent
parameter.description: The total number of bytes transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: BytesReceived
parameter.description: The total number of bytes received on the interface, including framing characters. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: CellsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets (cells) transmitted out of the interface. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: CellsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of packets (cells) which were received on this interface. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: ErrorsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: ErrorsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: UnicastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets requested for transmission which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address, including those that were discarded or not sent. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: UnicastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being transmitted. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets requested for transmission which were addressed to a multicast address, including those that were discarded or not sent. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets which were addressed to a multicast address. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets requested for transmission which were addressed to a broadcast address, including those that were discarded or not sent. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets which were addressed to a broadcast address. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: UnknownProtoPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of packets received via the interface which were discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.WLANConfiguration.{i}.
object.description: This object models an 802.11 LAN connection on a CPE device. This object MUST be implemented for CPE that contain an 802.11 interface on the LAN side.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this interface. When there are multiple ''WLANConfiguration'' instances, e.g. each instance supports a different 802.11 standard or has a different security configuration, this parameter can be used to control which of the instances are currently enabled.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the status of this interface. {{enum}} The {{enum|Error}} value MAY be used by the CPE to indicate a locally defined error condition.

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: The name of this layer 2 interface, chosen by the vendor, e.g. "wlan0".

parameter.name: BSSID
parameter.description: The MAC address of the interface.

parameter.name: MaxBitRate
parameter.description: The maximum upstream and downstream bit rate available to this connection in Mbps. Either ''Auto'', or the largest of the {{param|OperationalDataTransmitRates}} values.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.description: The current radio channel used by the connection. To request automatic channel selection, set {{param|AutoChannelEnable}} to {{true}}. Whenever {{param|AutoChannelEnable}} is {{true}}, the value of the {{param}} parameter MUST be the channel selected by the automatic channel selection procedure.

parameter.name: AutoChannelEnable
parameter.description: Enable or disable automatic channel selection. Set to {{false}} to disable the automatic channel selection procedure, in which case the currently selected channel remains selected. Set to {{true}} to enable the automatic channel selection procedure. This procedure MUST automatically select the channel, and MAY also change it subsequently. {{param}} MUST automatically change to {{false}} whenever the channel is manually selected, i.e. whenever the {{param|Channel}} parameter is written. Whenever {{param}} is {{true}}, the value of the {{param|Channel}} parameter MUST be the channel selected by the automatic channel selection procedure.

parameter.name: SSID
parameter.description: The current service set identifier in use by the connection. The SSID is an identifier that is attached to packets sent over the wireless LAN that functions as a "password" for joining a particular radio network (BSS). Note: If an access point wishes to be known by more than one SSID, it MUST provide a ''WLANConfiguration'' instance for each SSID.

parameter.name: BeaconType
parameter.description: The capabilities that are currently enabled on the access point (and that are announced via beacons if {{param|BeaconAdvertisementEnabled}} is {{true}}). Write access to this parameter enables and disables such capabilities. An attempt to set this parameter to one of the REQUIRED (mandatory) values MAY be rejected if (and only if) the requested capability is not available on this WLANConfiguration instance but is available on another WLANConfiguration instance within this Internet Gateway Device. For example, only basic 802.11 might be supported by one virtual AP, and only WPA might be supported by another virtual AP. A value of {{enum|None}} means that no capabilities are currently enabled on the access point and that no stations will be able to associate with it. {{enum}} {{enum|11i}} SHOULD be taken to refer to both the 802.11i specification and to the WPA2 specification (any WPA2-certified device will implement all mandatory parts of the 802.11i standard). The OBSOLETED values are those for Basic + WPA/WPA2 mixed modes, which are not permitted by the WPA specifications.

parameter.name: MACAddressControlEnabled
parameter.description: Indicates whether MAC Address Control is enabled or not on this interface. MAC Address Control limits the clients that connect to those that match a list of allowed MAC addresses specified in {{param|InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.LANHostConfigManagement.AllowedMACAddresses}}.

parameter.name: Standard
WEPKeyIndex
parameter.description: The index of the default WEP key.

parameter.name: KeyPassphrase
parameter.description: A passphrase from which the WEP keys are to be generated. This parameter is the same as the parameter ''InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.WLANConfiguration.{i}.PreSharedKey.1.KeyPassphrase'' for the same instance of ''WLANConfiguration''. When either parameter is changed, the value of the other is changed as well. If {{param}} is written, all four WEP keys are immediately generated. The ACS SHOULD NOT set the passphrase and also set the WEP keys directly (the result of doing this is undefined). This MUST either be a valid key length divided by 8, in which case each byte contributes 8 bits to the key, or else MUST consist of Hex digits and be a valid key length divided by 4, in which case each byte contributes 4 bits to the key. Note: If a passphrase is used, all four WEP keys will be the same.

parameter.name: WEPEncryptionLevel
BasicEncryptionModes
parameter.description: Encryption modes that are available when basic 802.11 is enabled. {{enum|WEPEncryption}} implies that all wireless clients can use WEP for data encryption. {{enum}} If this ''WLANConfiguration'' instance does not support basic 802.11 then this parameter MUST NOT be present in this instance of the ''WLANConfiguration'' object.

parameter.name: BasicAuthenticationMode
parameter.description: Authentication modes that are available when basic 802.11 is enabled. {{enum}} If this ''WLANConfiguration'' instance does not support basic 802.11 then this parameter MUST NOT be present in this instance of the ''WLANConfiguration'' object.

parameter.name: WPAEncryptionModes
WPAAuthenticationMode
parameter.description: Authentication modes that are available when WPA is enabled. {{enum}} If this ''WLANConfiguration'' instance does not support WPA then this parameter MUST NOT be present in this instance of the ''WLANConfiguration'' object.

parameter.name: IEEE11iEncryptionModes
parameter.description: Encryption modes that are available when 802.11i is enabled. {{enum}} If this ''WLANConfiguration'' instance does not support 802.11i then this parameter MUST NOT be present in this instance of the ''WLANConfiguration'' object. ''IEEE11i'' SHOULD be taken to refer to both the 802.11i specification and to the WPA2 specification (any WPA2-certified device will implement all mandatory parts of the 802.11i standard). The DEPRECATED values are those that combine WEP with TKIP and/or AES, which is not permitted by the WPA2 specifications.

parameter.name: IEEE11iAuthenticationMode
PossibleChannels
parameter.description: Possible radio channels for the wireless standard (a, b or g) and the regulatory domain. Ranges in the form "n-m" are permitted. For example, for 802.11b and North America, would be "1-11".

parameter.name: BasicDataTransmitRates
parameter.description: Maximum access point data transmit rates in Mbps for unicast, multicast and broadcast frames. For example, a value of "1,2", indicates that unicast, multicast and broadcast frames can be transmitted at 1 Mbps and 2 Mbps.

parameter.name: OperationalDataTransmitRates
parameter.description: Maximum access point data transmit rates in Mbps for unicast frames (a superset of {{param|BasicDataTransmitRates}}). Given the value of {{param|BasicDataTransmitRates}} from the example above, {{param}} might be "1,2,5.5,11", indicating that unicast frames can additionally be transmitted at 5.5 Mbps and 11 Mbps.

parameter.name: PossibleDataTransmitRates
parameter.description: Data transmit rates for unicast frames at which the access point will permit a station to connect (a subset of {{param|OperationalDataTransmitRates}}). Given the values of {{param|BasicDataTransmitRates}} and {{param|OperationalDataTransmitRates}} from the examples above, {{param}} might be "1,2,5.5", indicating that the AP will only permit connections at 1 Mbps, 2 Mbps and 5.5 Mbps, even though it could theoretically accept connections at 11 Mbps.

parameter.name: InsecureOOBAccessEnabled
parameter.description: Indicates whether insecure write access via mechanisms other than the CPE WAN Management Protocol is permitted to the parameters in this object.

parameter.name: BeaconAdvertisementEnabled
parameter.description: Indicates whether or not the access point is sending out beacons.

parameter.name: SSIDAdvertisementEnabled
parameter.description: Indicates whether or not beacons include the SSID name. This parameter has an effect only if {{param|BeaconAdvertisementEnabled}} is {{true}}.

parameter.name: RadioEnabled
parameter.description: Indicates whether or not the access point radio is enabled.

parameter.name: TransmitPowerSupported
parameter.description: Supported transmit power levels as percentages of full power. For example, "0,25,50,75,100".

parameter.name: TransmitPower
parameter.description: Indicates the current transmit power level as a percentage of full power. The value MUST be one of the values reported by the {{param|TransmitPowerSupported}} parameter.

parameter.name: AutoRateFallBackEnabled
parameter.description: Indicates whether the access point can automatically reduce the data rate in the event of undue noise or contention.

parameter.name: LocationDescription
parameter.description: An XML description of information used to identify the access point by name and physical location. The CPE is not expected to parse this string, but simply to treat it as an opaque string. {{empty}} indicates no location has been set.

parameter.name: RegulatoryDomain
parameter.description: 802.11d Regulatory Domain String. First two octets are ISO/IEC 3166-1 two-character country code. The third octet is either " " (all environments), "O" (outside) or "I" (inside).

parameter.name: TotalPSKFailures
parameter.description: The number of times pre-shared key (PSK) authentication has failed (relevant only to WPA and 802.11i).

parameter.name: TotalIntegrityFailures
parameter.description: The number of times the MICHAEL integrity check has failed (relevant only to WPA and 802.11i)

parameter.name: ChannelsInUse
parameter.description: Channels that the access point determines to be currently in use (including any that it is using itself). Ranges in the form "n-m" are permitted.

parameter.name: DeviceOperationMode
parameter.description: The current access-point operating mode. The OPTIONAL modes permit the AP to be configured as a wireless bridge (to bridge two wired networks), repeater (a bridge that also serves wireless clients), or wireless station. Ad hoc stations are not supported.

parameter.name: DistanceFromRoot
parameter.description: The number of hops from the root access point to the wireless repeater or bridge.

parameter.name: PeerBSSID
parameter.description: The MAC address of the peer in wireless repeater or bridge mode.

parameter.name: AuthenticationServiceMode
parameter.description: Indicates whether another service is involved in client authentication ({{enum|LinkAuthentication}} for a co-located authentication server; {{enum|RadiusClient}} for an external RADIUS server).

parameter.name: WMMSupported
parameter.description: Indicates whether this interface supports WiFi Multimedia (WMM) Access Categories (AC).

parameter.name: UAPSDSupported
parameter.description: Indicates whether this interface supports WMM Unscheduled Automatic Power Save Delivery (U-APSD). Note: U-APSD support implies WMM support.

parameter.name: WMMEnable
parameter.description: Whether WMM support is currently enabled. When enabled, this is indicated in beacon frames

parameter.name: UAPSDEnable
parameter.description: Whether U-APSD support is currently enabled. When enabled, this is indicated in beacon frames. Note: U-APSD can only be enabled if WMM is also enabled.

parameter.name: TotalBytesSent
parameter.description: The total number of bytes transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: TotalBytesReceived
parameter.description: The total number of bytes received on the interface, including framing characters. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: TotalPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets transmitted out of the interface. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: TotalPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of packets which were received on this interface. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: TotalAssociations
parameter.description: The number of devices currently associated with the access point. This corresponds to the number of entries in the AssociatedDevice table.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.WLANConfiguration.{i}.AssociatedDevice.{i}.
object.description: A table of the devices currently associated with the access point. The size of this table is given by {{param|InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.WLANConfiguration.{i}.TotalAssociations}}. This object MUST be implemented for CPE that contain an 802.11 interface on the LAN side.

parameter.name: AssociatedDeviceMACAddress
parameter.description: The MAC address of an associated device.

parameter.name: AssociatedDeviceIPAddress
parameter.description: The IP address or DNS name of an associated device.

parameter.name: AssociatedDeviceAuthenticationState
parameter.description: Whether an associated device has authenticated ({{true}}) or not ({{false}}).

parameter.name: LastRequestedUnicastCipher
parameter.description: The unicast cipher that was most recently used for a station with a specified MAC address (802.11i only).

parameter.name: LastRequestedMulticastCipher
parameter.description: The multicast cipher that was most recently used for a station with a specified MAC address (802.11i only).

parameter.name: LastPMKId
parameter.description: The pairwise master key (PMK) that was most recently used for a station with a specified MAC address (802.11i only).

parameter.name: LastDataTransmitRate
parameter.description: The data transmit rate that was most recently used for a station with a specified MAC address.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.WLANConfiguration.{i}.WEPKey.{i}.
object.description: This is a table of WEP keys. The size of this table is fixed with exactly 4 entries (with instance numbers 1 through 4). This object MUST be implemented for CPE that contain an 802.11 interface on the LAN side.

parameter.name: WEPKey
parameter.description: A WEP key expressed as a hexadecimal string. The WEP encryption level for a given key is inferred from the key length, e.g. 10 characters for 40-bit encryption, or 26 characters for 104-bit encryption (keys do not all have to be of the same length, although they will be if the CPE uses {{param|InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.WLANConfiguration.{i}.KeyPassphrase}} to generate them). If {{param|InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.WLANConfiguration.{i}.KeyPassphrase}} is written, all four WEP keys are immediately generated. The ACS SHOULD NOT set the passphrase and also set the WEP keys directly (the result of doing this is undefined).

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.WLANConfiguration.{i}.PreSharedKey.{i}.
object.description: This is a table of preshared keys. The size of this table is fixed with exactly 10 entries (with instance numbers 1 through 10). This object MUST be implemented for CPE that contain an 802.11 interface on the LAN side.

parameter.name: PreSharedKey
parameter.description: A literal WPA PSK expressed as a hexadecimal string. The first table entry contains the default {{param}} (''InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.WLANConfiguration.{i}.PreSharedKey.1.PreSharedKey''). If {{param|KeyPassphrase}} is written, the PSK is immediately generated. The ACS SHOULD NOT set the passphrase and also set the PSK directly (the result of doing this is undefined).

parameter.name: KeyPassphrase
parameter.description: A passphrase from which the PSK is to be generated. The first table entry is the same as the parameter {{param|InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.WLANConfiguration.{i}.KeyPassphrase}} for the same instance of WLANConfiguration. When either parameter is changed, the value of the other is changed as well. If {{param}} is written, the PSK is immediately generated. The ACS SHOULD NOT set the passphrase and also set the PSK directly (the result of doing this is undefined). The key is generated as specified by WPA, which uses PBKDF2 from PKCS #5: Password-based Cryptography Specification Version 2.0 (RFC 2898 {{bibref|RFC2898}}).

parameter.name: AssociatedDeviceMACAddress
parameter.description: The MAC address associated with a preshared key, or {{empty}} if no MAC address is associated with the key.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.WLANConfiguration.{i}.Stats.
object.description: This object contains statistics for an 802.11 LAN interface on a CPE device. Note that these statistics refer to the link layer, not to the physical layer. Note that this object does not include the total byte and packet statistics, which are, for historical reasons, in the parent object.

parameter.name: ErrorsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: ErrorsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: UnicastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets requested for transmission which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address, including those that were discarded or not sent. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: UnicastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being transmitted. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets requested for transmission which were addressed to a multicast address, including those that were discarded or not sent. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets which were addressed to a multicast address. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets requested for transmission which were addressed to a broadcast address, including those that were discarded or not sent. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets which were addressed to a broadcast address. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

parameter.name: UnknownProtoPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of packets received via the interface which were discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol. The value of this counter MAY be reset to zero when the CPE is rebooted.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.WLANConfiguration.{i}.WPS.
object.description: This object contains parameters related to WPS (Wi-Fi Protected Setup) {{bibref|WPSv1.0}} that apply to a CPE acting as an Access Point.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables WPS functionality for this interface.

parameter.name: DeviceName
parameter.description: User-friendly description of the device. This parameter corresponds directly to the "Device Name" attribute of the WPS specification {{bibref|WPSv1.0}}.

parameter.name: DevicePassword
parameter.description: Represents the DevicePassword used (commonly known as PIN). This parameter corresponds directly to the "Device Password" attribute of the WPS specification {{bibref|WPSv1.0}}.

parameter.name: UUID
parameter.description: UUID of the device. This is represented as specified in RFC 4122 {{bibref|RFC4122}} but omitting the leading "urn:uuid:", e.g. "f81d4fae-7dec-11d0-a765-00a0c91e6bf6". This parameter corresponds directly to the "UUID-E" (enrollee) and "UUID-R" (registrar) attributes of the WPS specification {{bibref|WPSv1.0}}. Note that if the Access Point can act both as an enrollee and as a registrar then UUID-E and UUID-R will be the same as each other.

parameter.name: Version
parameter.description: The Wi-Fi Protected Setup version supported by the device. This parameter corresponds directly to the "Version" attribute of the WPS specification {{bibref|WPSv1.0}}.

parameter.name: ConfigMethodsSupported
parameter.description: WPS configuration methods supported by the device. {{enum}} This parameter corresponds directly to the "Config Methods" attribute of the WPS specification {{bibref|WPSv1.0}}.

parameter.name: ConfigMethodsEnabled
parameter.description: WPS configuration methods enabled on the device. This parameter corresponds directly to the "Permitted Config Methods" attribute of the WPS specification {{bibref|WPSv1.0}}.

parameter.name: SetupLockedState
parameter.description: Indicates if the AP Setup mode is enabled for configuration of the AP through an external registrar. The AP Setup mode can be disabled by the user, by the remote management or in case of a brute force attack against the AP's PIN (Wrong PIN provided to AP multiple times). {{enum}} This parameter corresponds directly to the "AP Setup Locked" attribute of the WPS specification {{bibref|WPSv1.0}}. The factory default setting is {{enum|Unlocked}}.

parameter.name: SetupLock
parameter.description: When set to {{true}}, the Access Point will refuse to accept new external registrars; already established registrars will continue to be able to add new enrollees (the {{param|SetupLockedState}} becomes {{enum|LockedByRemoteManagement|SetupLockedState}}). When set to {{false}}, the Access Point is enabled for configuration through an external registrar (the {{param|SetupLockedState}} becomes {{enum|Unlocked|SetupLockedState}}). The factory default setting is {{false}}.

parameter.name: ConfigurationState
parameter.description: Description of the WPS status on the Wireless Access Point side. {{enum}} This parameter corresponds directly to the "Wi-Fi Protected Setup State" attribute of the WPS specification {{bibref|WPSv1.0}}.

enumeration.description: WLAN interface is unconfigured: out-of-the box configuration

parameter.name: LastConfigurationError
RegistrarNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of entries in the Registrar table: number of Registrars that currently have an association with the Access Point. This parameter corresponds directly to the "Registrar Current" attribute of the WPS specification {{bibref|WPSv1.0}}.

parameter.name: RegistrarEstablished
parameter.description: {{true}} if the Access Point has ever previously created an association with a Registrar. This parameter corresponds directly to the "Registrar Established" attribute of the WPS specification {{bibref|WPSv1.0}}. The factory default setting is {{false}}.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.WLANConfiguration.{i}.WPS.Registrar.{i}.
object.description: This table lists the Registrars associated with the Access Point. This table MUST persist across CPE reboots. The registrar UUID is the unique key. This object corresponds directly to the "Registrar List" attribute of the WPS specification {{bibref|WPSv1.0}}.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: If {{true}}, the registrar can be used by the Access Point for WPS procedures.

parameter.name: UUID
parameter.description: UUID of the registrar. This is represented as specified in RFC 4122 {{bibref|RFC4122}} but omitting the leading "urn:uuid:", e.g. ''f81d4fae-7dec-11d0-a765-00a0c91e6bf6''. This parameter corresponds directly to the "UUID-R" attribute of the WPS specification {{bibref|WPSv1.0}}.

parameter.name: DeviceName
parameter.description: Device Name of the registrar. This parameter corresponds directly to the "Device Name" attribute of the WPS specification {{bibref|WPSv1.0}}.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.WLANConfiguration.{i}.APWMMParameter.{i}.
object.description: This is a table of WMM parameters for traffic that originates at the wireless access point, i.e. for outgoing traffic. The size of this table is fixed, with 4 entries (with instance numbers 1 through 4). Instance numbers MUST be assigned as follows: # BE AC (Best Effort) # BK AC (Background) # VI AC (Video) # VO AC (Voice)

parameter.name: AIFSN
parameter.description: Arbitration Inter Frame Spacing (Number). This is the number of time slots in the arbitration interframe space.

parameter.name: ECWMin
parameter.description: Exponent of Contention Window (Minimum). This encodes the Values of CWMin as an exponent: CWMin = 2^ECWMin - 1. For example, if ECWMin is 8, then CWMin is 2^8 - 1, or 255,

parameter.name: ECWMax
parameter.description: Exponent of Contention Window (Maximum). This encodes the Values of CWMax as an exponent: CWMax = 2^ECWMax - 1. For example, if ECWMax is 8, then CWMax is 2^8 - 1, or 255,

parameter.name: TXOP
parameter.description: Transmit Opportunity, in multiples of 32 microseconds.

parameter.name: AckPolicy
parameter.description: Ack Policy, where {{false}}=''Do Not Acknowledge'' and {{true}}=''Acknowledge''.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.WLANConfiguration.{i}.STAWMMParameter.{i}.
object.description: This is a table of WMM parameters for traffic that originates at the wireless station, i.e. for incoming traffic. The size of this table is fixed, with 4 entries (with instance numbers 1 through 4). Instance numbers MUST be assigned as follows: # BE AC (Best Effort) # BK AC (Background) # VI AC (Video) # VO AC (Voice)

parameter.name: AIFSN
parameter.description: Arbitration Inter Frame Spacing (Number). This is the number of time slots in the arbitration interframe space.

parameter.name: ECWMin
parameter.description: Exponent of Contention Window (Minimum). This encodes the Values of CWMin as an exponent: CWMin = 2^ECWMin - 1. For example, if ECWMin is 8, then CWMin is 2^8 - 1, or 255,

parameter.name: ECWMax
parameter.description: Exponent of Contention Window (Maximum). This encodes the Values of CWMax as an exponent: CWMax = 2^ECWMax - 1. For example, if ECWMax is 8, then CWMax is 2^8 - 1, or 255,

parameter.name: TXOP
parameter.description: Transmit Opportunity, in multiples of 32 microseconds.

parameter.name: AckPolicy
parameter.description: Ack Policy, where {{false}}=''Do Not Acknowledge'' and {{true}}=''Acknowledge''.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.Hosts.
object.description: This object provides information about each of the hosts on the LAN, including those whose IP address was allocated by the CPE using DHCP as well as hosts with statically allocated IP addresses.

parameter.name: HostNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: Number of entries in the {{object|Host}} table.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.{i}.Hosts.Host.{i}.
object.description: Host table.

parameter.name: IPAddress
parameter.description: Current IP Address of the host.

parameter.name: AddressSource
parameter.description: Indicates whether the IP address of the host was allocated by the CPE using DHCP, was assigned to the host statically, or was assigned using automatic IP address allocation.

parameter.name: LeaseTimeRemaining
parameter.description: DHCP lease time remaining in seconds. A value of -1 indicates an infinite lease. The value MUST be 0 (zero) if the {{param|AddressSource}} is not {{enum|DHCP|AddressSource}}.

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description: MAC address of the host.

parameter.name: Layer2Interface
parameter.description: This parameter is the full hierarchical parameter name of a particular ''LAN**InterfaceConfig'' object or a ''WLANConfiguration'' object. For example: ''InternetGatewayDevice.LANDevice.1.LANEthernetInterfaceConfig.2''. In the case of an embedded Ethernet switch, the {{param}} parameter references the ''LANEthernetInterfaceConfig'' object that corresponds to the switch port the device is connected to (a ''LANEthernetInterfaceConfig'' instance for each switch port). In the case of an embedded WLAN access point, the {{param}} parameter references the ''WLANConfiguration'' object that corresponds to the SSID the device is connected to (if the access point supports multiple SSIDs, then each SSID is a separate instance).

parameter.name: VendorClassID
parameter.description: Vendor Class Identifier DHCP option (Option 60) of the host. It MAY be defined when ''AddressSource'' is ''DHCP''. {{empty}} indicates this option is not used.

parameter.name: ClientID
parameter.description: Client Identifier DHCP option (Option 61) for the specific IP connection of the client. The option value is binary, so an exact match is REQUIRED. It MAY be defined when ''AddressSource'' is ''DHCP''. {{empty}} indicates this option is not used.

parameter.name: UserClassID
parameter.description: User Class Identifier DHCP option (Option 77) of the host. It MAY be defined when ''AddressSource'' is ''DHCP''. {{empty}} indicates this option is not used.

parameter.name: HostName
parameter.description: The device's host name or {{empty}} if unknown.

parameter.name: InterfaceType
parameter.description: Type of physical interface through which this host is connected to the CPE.

parameter.name: Active
parameter.description: Whether or not the host is currently present on the LAN. The method of presence detection is a local matter to the CPE. The ability to list inactive hosts is OPTIONAL. If the CPE includes inactive hosts in this table, this variable MUST be set to {{false}} for each inactive host. The length of time an inactive host remains listed in this table is a local matter to the CPE.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANCommonInterfaceConfig.
object.description: This object models WAN interface properties common across all connection instances.

parameter.name: EnabledForInternet
parameter.description: Used to enable or disable access to and from the Internet across all connection instances.

parameter.name: WANAccessType
parameter.description: Specifies the WAN access (modem) type.

parameter.name: Layer1UpstreamMaxBitRate
parameter.description: Specifies the maximum upstream theoretical bit rate for the WAN device in bits per second. This describes the maximum possible rate given the type of interface assuming the best-case operating environment, regardless of the current operating rate. For example, if the physical interface is 100BaseT, this value would be 100000000, regardless of the current operating rate.

parameter.name: Layer1DownstreamMaxBitRate
parameter.description: Specifies the maximum downstream theoretical bit rate for the WAN device in bits per second. This describes the maximum possible rate given the type of interface assuming the best-case operating environment, regardless of the current operating rate. For example, if the physical interface is 100BaseT, this value would be 100000000, regardless of the current operating rate.

parameter.name: PhysicalLinkStatus
parameter.description: Indicates the state of the physical connection (link) from WANDevice to a connected entity.

parameter.name: WANAccessProvider
parameter.description: Name of the Service Provider providing link connectivity on the WAN.

parameter.name: TotalBytesSent
parameter.description: The cumulative counter for total number of bytes sent upstream across all connection service instances on the WAN device.

parameter.name: TotalBytesReceived
parameter.description: The cumulative counter for total number of bytes received downstream across all connection service instances on the WAN device.

parameter.name: TotalPacketsSent
parameter.description: The cumulative counter for total number of packets (IP or PPP) sent upstream across all connection service instances on the WAN device.

parameter.name: TotalPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The cumulative counter for total number of packets (IP or PPP) received downstream across all connection service instances on the WAN device.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANDSLInterfaceConfig.
object.description: This object models physical layer properties specific to a single physical connection of a DSL modem used for Internet access on a CPE. This object is required for a CPE with a DSL modem WAN interface, and is exclusive of any other ''WAN*InterfaceConfig'' object within a given ''WANDevice'' instance.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the link.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Status of the DSL physical link. {{enum}} The {{enum|Error}} value MAY be used by the CPE to indicate a locally defined error condition.

parameter.name: LinkEncapsulationSupported
parameter.description: Indicates which link encapsulation standards and recommendations are supported by the B-NT.

parameter.name: LinkEncapsulationRequested
parameter.description: Indicates the link encapsulation standard requested by the B-NT.

parameter.name: LinkEncapsulationUsed
ModulationType
StandardsSupported
parameter.description: Indicates which DSL standards and recommendations are supported by the B-NT.

parameter.name: StandardUsed
parameter.description: Indicates the standard that the B-NT is using for the connection.

parameter.name: LineEncoding
parameter.description: The line encoding method used in establishing the Layer 1 DSL connection between the CPE and the DSLAM. Note: Generally speaking, this variable does not change after provisioning.

parameter.name: AllowedProfiles
CurrentProfile
parameter.description: Indicates which VDSL2 profile is currently in use on the line. Note: This parameter is OPTIONAL at the G and S/T interfaces in G.997.1 Amendment 1. If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be {{empty}}.

parameter.name: PowerManagementState
parameter.description: The power management state of the line.

parameter.name: SuccessFailureCause
parameter.description: The success failure cause of the initialization. An enumeration of the following integer values: * 0: Successful * 1: Configuration error. This error occurs with inconsistencies in configuration parameters, e.g. when the line is initialized in an xDSL Transmission system where an xTU does not support the configured Maximum Delay or the configured Minimum or Maximum Data Rate for one or more bearer channels. * 2: Configuration not feasible on the line. This error occurs if the Minimum Data Rate cannot be reached on the line with the Minimum Noise Margin, Maximum PSD level, Maximum Delay and Maximum Bit Error Ratio for one or more bearer channels. * 3: Communication problem. This error occurs, for example, due to corrupted messages or bad syntax messages or if no common mode can be selected in the G.994.1 handshaking procedure or due to a timeout.. * 4: No peer xTU detected. This error occurs if the peer xTU is not powered or not connected or if the line is too long to allow detection of a peer xTU. * 5: Any other or unknown Initialization Failure cause.

parameter.name: LastStateTransmittedDownstream
parameter.description: This parameter represents the last successful transmitted initialization state in the downstream direction in the last full initialization performed on the line. Initialization states are defined in the individual xDSL Recommendations and are counted from 0 (if G.994.1 is used) or 1 (if G.994.1 is not used) up to Showtime. This parameter needs to be interpreted along with the xDSL Transmission System. This parameter is available only when, after a failed full initialization, the line diagnostics procedures are activated on the line.

parameter.name: LastStateTransmittedUpstream
parameter.description: This parameter represents the last successful transmitted initialization state in the upstream direction in the last full initialization performed on the line. Initialization states are defined in the individual xDSL Recommendations and are counted from 0 (if G.994.1 is used) or 1 (if G.994.1 is not used) up to Showtime. This parameter needs to be interpreted along with the xDSL Transmission System. This parameter is available only when, after a failed full initialization, the line diagnostics procedures are activated on the line.

parameter.name: UPBOKLE
parameter.description: This parameter contains the estimated electrical loop length expressed in dB at 1MHz, kle (see O-UPDATE in section 12.2.4.2.1.2/G.993.2). The value SHALL be coded as an unsigned 16 bit number in the range 0 (coded as 0) to 128 dB (coded as 1280) in steps of 0.1 dB.

parameter.name: MREFPSDds
parameter.description: This parameter SHALL contain the set of breakpoints exchanged in the MREFPSDds fields of the O-PRM message of G.993.2. Base64 encoded of the binary representation defined in Table 12-19/G.993.2 (maximum length is 145 octets, which requires 196 bytes for Base64 encoding).

parameter.name: MREFPSDus
parameter.description: This parameter SHALL contain the set of breakpoints exchanged in the MREFPSDus fields of the R-PRM message of G.993.2. Base64 encoded of the binary representation defined in Table 12-19/G.993.2 (maximum length is 145 octets, which requires 196 bytes for Base64 encoding).

parameter.name: LIMITMASK
parameter.description: Indicates the enabled VDSL2 Limit PSD mask of the selected PSD mask class. Bit mask as specified in ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. Note: For a VDSL2-capable multimode device operating in a mode other than VDSL2, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to 0.

parameter.name: US0MASK
parameter.description: Indicates the allowed VDSL2 US0 PSD masks for Annex A operation. Bit mask as specified in see ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. Note: For a VDSL2-capable multimode device operating in a mode other than VDSL2, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to 0.

parameter.name: DataPath
InterleaveDepth
parameter.description: ADSL1 Interleaved depth. This variable is only applicable to ADSL1 and only if {{param|DataPath}} = {{enum|Interleaved|DataPath}}. Otherwise, the value of this parameter MUST be zero.

parameter.name: LPATH
parameter.description: Reports the index of the latency path supporting the bearer channel. For single-latency connections, LPATH = 0. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1.

parameter.name: INTLVDEPTH
parameter.description: Reports the interleaver depth D for the latency path indicated in LPATH. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to -1.

parameter.name: INTLVBLOCK
parameter.description: Reports the interleaver block length in use on the latency path indicated in LPATH. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to -1.

parameter.name: ActualInterleavingDelay
parameter.description: Reports the actual delay, in milliseconds, of the latency path due to interleaving. Note: In G.997.1, this parameter is called "Actual Interleaving Delay." See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1.

parameter.name: ACTINP
parameter.description: Reports the actual impulse noise protection (INP) provided by the latency path indicated in LPATH. The value is the actual INP in the L0 (i.e., Showtime) state. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to -1.

parameter.name: INPREPORT
parameter.description: Reports whether the value reported in ACTINP was computed assuming the receiver does not use erasure decoding. Valid values are 0 (computed per the formula assuming no erasure decoding) and 1 (computed by taking into account erasure decoding capabilities of receiver). Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to {{false}}.

parameter.name: NFEC
parameter.description: Reports the size, in octets, of the Reed-Solomon codeword in use on the latency path indicated in LPATH. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to -1.

parameter.name: RFEC
parameter.description: Reports the number of redundancy bytes per Reed-Solomon codeword on the latency path indicated in LPATH. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to -1.

parameter.name: LSYMB
parameter.description: Reports the number of bits per symbol assigned to the latency path indicated in LPATH. This value does not include overhead due to trellis coding. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to -1.

parameter.name: TRELLISds
parameter.description: Reports whether trellis coding is enabled in the downstream direction. A value of 1 indicates that trellis coding is in use, and a value of 0 indicates that the trellis is disabled. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to -1.

parameter.name: TRELLISus
parameter.description: Reports whether trellis coding is enabled in the upstream direction. A value of 1 indicates that trellis coding is in use, and a value of 0 indicates that the trellis is disabled. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to -1.

parameter.name: ACTSNRMODEds
parameter.description: Reports whether the OPTIONAL virtual noise mechanism is in use in the downstream direction. A value of 1 indicates the virtual noise mechanism is not in use, and a value of 2 indicates the virtual noise mechanism is in use. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to 0.

parameter.name: ACTSNRMODEus
parameter.description: Reports whether the OPTIONAL virtual noise mechanism is in use in the upstream direction. A value of 1 indicates the virtual noise mechanism is not in use, and a value of 2 indicates the virtual noise mechanism is in use. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to 0.

parameter.name: VirtualNoisePSDds
parameter.description: Reports the virtual noise PSD for the downstream direction. Base64 encoded of the binary representation defined in G.997.1 by the parameter called TXREFVNds (maximum length is 97 octets, which requires 132 bytes for Base64 encoding). See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to {{empty}}.

parameter.name: VirtualNoisePSDus
parameter.description: Reports the virtual noise PSD for the upstream direction. Base64 encoded of the binary representation defined in G.997.1by the parameter called TXREFVNus (maximum length is 49 octets, which requires 68 bytes for Base64 encoding). See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to {{empty}}.

parameter.name: ACTUALCE
parameter.description: Reports the actual cyclic extension, as the value of m, in use for the connection. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1. For a multimode device operating in a mode in which this parameter does not apply, the value of this parameter SHOULD be set to 99.

parameter.name: LineNumber
parameter.description: Signifies the line pair that the modem is using to connection. {{param}} = 1 is the innermost pair.

parameter.name: UpstreamCurrRate
parameter.description: The current physical layer aggregate data rate (expressed in Kbps) of the upstream DSL connection. Note: This parameter is OPTIONAL at the G and S/T interfaces in G.997.1 Amendment 1. If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, it MUST have the value 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

parameter.name: DownstreamCurrRate
parameter.description: The current physical layer aggregate data rate (expressed in Kbps) of the downstream DSL connection. Note: This parameter is OPTIONAL at the G and S/T interfaces in G.997.1 Amendment 1. If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, it MUST have the value 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

parameter.name: UpstreamMaxRate
parameter.description: The current attainable rate (expressed in Kbps) of the upstream DSL channel. Note: This parameter is related to the G.997.1 parameter ATTNDRus, which is measured in bits/s. See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1.

parameter.name: DownstreamMaxRate
parameter.description: The current attainable rate (expressed in Kbps) of the downstream DSL channel. Note: This parameter is related to the G.997.1 parameter ATTNDRds, which is measured in bits/s. See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1.

parameter.name: UpstreamNoiseMargin
parameter.description: The current signal-to-noise ratio margin (expressed in 0.1 dB) in the upstream direction. Note: In G.997.1, this parameter is called SNRMus. See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1.

parameter.name: DownstreamNoiseMargin
parameter.description: The current signal-to-noise ratio margin (expressed in 0.1 dB) in the downstream direction. Note: In G.997.1, this parameter is called SNRMds. See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1.

parameter.name: SNRMpbus
parameter.description: The current signal-to-noise ratio margin of each upstream band. Interpretation of the values is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1.

parameter.name: SNRMpbds
parameter.description: The current signal-to-noise ratio margin of each band. Interpretation of the values is as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1. Note: See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1.

parameter.name: INMIATOds
parameter.description: The Impulse Noise Monitoring (INM) Inter Arrival Time (IAT) Offset, measured in DMT symbols, that the xTU receiver uses to determine in which bin of the IAT histogram the IAT is reported. Note: In G.997.1, this parameter is called INMIATO. See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1.

parameter.name: INMIATSds
parameter.description: The Impulse Noise Monitoring (INM) Inter Arrival Time (IAT) Step that the xTU receiver uses to determine in which bin of the IAT histogram the IAT is reported. Note: In G.997.1, this parameter is called INMIATS. See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1.

parameter.name: INMCCds
parameter.description: The Impulse Noise Monitoring (INM) Cluster Continuation value, measured in DMT symbols, that the xTU receiver uses in the cluster indication process. Note: In G.997.1, this parameter is called INMCC. See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1.

parameter.name: INMINPEQMODEds
parameter.description: The Impulse Noise Monitoring (INM) Equivalent Impulse Noise Protection (INP) Mode that the xTU receiver uses in the computation of the Equivalent INP. Note: In G.997.1, this parameter is called INM_INPEQ_MODE. See ITU-T Recommendation G.997.1.

parameter.name: UpstreamAttenuation
parameter.description: The current upstream signal loss (expressed in 0.1 dB).

parameter.name: DownstreamAttenuation
parameter.description: The current downstream signal loss (expressed in 0.1 dB).

parameter.name: UpstreamPower
parameter.description: The current output power at the CPE's DSL interface (expressed in 0.1 dBmV).

parameter.name: DownstreamPower
parameter.description: The current received power at the CPE's DSL interface (expressed in 0.1 dBmV).

parameter.name: ATURVendor
parameter.description: ATU-R vendor identifier as defined in G.994.1 and T1.413. In the case of G.994.1 this corresponds to the four-octet provider code, which MUST be represented as eight hexadecimal digits. Note: This parameter is OPTIONAL at the G and S/T interfaces in G.997.1 Amendment 1. If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, it MUST have the value "00000000".

parameter.name: ATURCountry
parameter.description: T.35 country code of the ATU-R vendor as defined in G.994.1, where the two-octet value defined in G.994.1 MUST be represented as four hexadecimal digits. Note: This parameter is OPTIONAL at the G and S/T interfaces in G.997.1 Amendment 1. If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, it MUST have the value "0000".

parameter.name: ATURANSIStd
parameter.description: ATU-R T1.413 Revision Number as defined in T1.413 Issue 2. When T1.413 modulation is not in use, the parameter value SHOULD be 0.

parameter.name: ATURANSIRev
parameter.description: ATU-R Vendor Revision Number as defined in T1.413 Issue 2. When T1.413 modulation is not in use, the parameter value SHOULD be 0.

parameter.name: ATUCVendor
parameter.description: ATU-C vendor identifier as defined in G.994.1 and T1.413. In the case of G.994.1 this corresponds to the four-octet provider code, which MUST be represented as eight hexadecimal digits. Note: This parameter is OPTIONAL at the G and S/T interfaces in G.997.1 Amendment 1. If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, it MUST have the value "00000000".

parameter.name: ATUCCountry
parameter.description: T.35 country code of the ATU-C vendor as defined in G.994.1, where the two-octet value defined in G.994.1 MUST be represented as four hexadecimal digits. Note: This parameter is OPTIONAL at the G and S/T interfaces in G.997.1 Amendment 1. If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, it MUST have the value "0000".

parameter.name: ATUCANSIStd
parameter.description: ATU-C T1.413 Revision Number as defined in T1.413 Issue 2. When T1.413 modulation is not in use, the parameter value SHOULD be 0.

parameter.name: ATUCANSIRev
parameter.description: ATU-C Vendor Revision Number as defined in T1.413 Issue 2. When T1.413 modulation is not in use, the parameter value SHOULD be 0.

parameter.name: TotalStart
parameter.description: Number of seconds since the beginning of the period used for collection of ''Total'' statistics. Statistics SHOULD continue to be accumulated across CPE reboots, though this might not always be possible.

parameter.name: ShowtimeStart
parameter.description: Number of seconds since the most recent DSL Showtime - the beginning of the period used for collection of ''Showtime'' statistics. Showtime is defined as successful completion of the DSL link establishment process. The ''Showtime'' statistics are those collected since the most recent establishment of the DSL link.

parameter.name: LastShowtimeStart
parameter.description: Number of seconds since the second most recent DSL Showtime-the beginning of the period used for collection of ''LastShowtime'' statistics. If the CPE has not retained information about the second most recent Showtime (e.g., on reboot), the start of ''LastShowtime'' statistics MAY temporarily coincide with the start of ''Showtime'' statistics.

parameter.name: CurrentDayStart
parameter.description: Number of seconds since the beginning of the period used for collection of ''CurrentDay'' statistics. The CPE MAY align the beginning of each CurrentDay interval with days in the UTC time zone, but does not have to do so. Statistics SHOULD continue to be accumulated across CPE reboots, though this might not always be possible.

parameter.name: QuarterHourStart
parameter.description: Number of seconds since the beginning of the period used for collection of ''QuarterHour'' statistics. The CPE MAY align the beginning of each QuarterHour interval with real-time quarter-hour intervals, but does not have to do so. Statistics SHOULD continue to be accumulated across CPE reboots, though this might not always be possible.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANDSLInterfaceConfig.Stats.
object.description: This object contains statistics for a WAN DSL physical interface.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANDSLInterfaceConfig.Stats.Total.
object.description: This object contains DSL total statistics.

parameter.name: ReceiveBlocks
parameter.description: Total number of successfully received blocks, where a block is as defined in RFC 2662 {{bibref|RFC2662}}. This parameter is DEPRECATED because it is not available at either the G or the S/T interface.

parameter.name: TransmitBlocks
parameter.description: Total number of successfully transmitted blocks, where a block is as defined in RFC 2662 {{bibref|RFC2662}}. This parameter is DEPRECATED because it is not available at either the G or the S/T interface.

parameter.name: CellDelin
parameter.description: Total number of cell-delineation errors (total seconds with NCD or LCD failures as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1). This parameter is DEPRECATED because it is not available at either the G or the S/T interface.

parameter.name: LinkRetrain
parameter.description: Total number of link-retrain errors (Full Initialization Count as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1). This parameter is DEPRECATED because it is not available at either the G or the S/T interface.

parameter.name: InitErrors
parameter.description: Total number of initialization errors (LINIT failures as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1). This parameter is DEPRECATED because it is not defined in G.997.1.

parameter.name: LInit
parameter.description: LInit is a flag to signal that a failure occurred as defined in G.997.1.

parameter.name: InitTimeouts
parameter.description: Total number of initialization timeout errors.

parameter.name: LossOfFraming
parameter.description: Total number of loss-of-framing errors (LOF failures as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1). This parameter is DEPRECATED because it is not defined in G.997.1.

parameter.name: LOF
parameter.description: This parameter corresponds to LOF as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1. LOF is a flag to signal that a failure occurred.

parameter.name: ErroredSecs
parameter.description: Total number of errored seconds (ES-L as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1). Note: This parameter is OPTIONAL at the G and S/T interfaces in G.997.1 Amendment 1. If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

parameter.name: ATUCErroredSecs
parameter.description: Total number of errored seconds detected by the ATU-C (ES-L as defined in ITU-T Rec. G.997.1). Note: This parameter is OPTIONAL at the G and S/T interfaces in G.997.1 Amendment 1. If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).
